definition: a boisterous practical joke (especially by college students), break into lumps before sorting
details:
noun
- a boisterous practical joke (especially by college students)
- a small piece of cloth or paper
= synonyms: tag
- newspaper with half-size pages
= synonyms: sheet, tabloid
- music with a syncopated melody (usually for the piano)
= synonyms: ragtime
- a week at British universities during which side-shows and processions of floats are organized to raise money for charities
= synonyms: rag week
verb
- break into lumps before sorting
- censure severely or angrily
= synonyms: lecture, jaw, rebuke, reproof, reprimand, scold, dress down, call on the carpet, take to task, trounce, call down, chide, berate, bawl out, remonstrate, chew out, chew up, have words, lambaste, lambast
- harass with persistent criticism or carping
= synonyms: rally
- play in ragtime
= example: play in ragtime
- cause annoyance in
= synonyms: fret, bother, devil, chafe, nark, nettle, gravel, irritate, get to, vex, rile, annoy, get at
- treat cruelly
= synonyms: torment
